subtitle: This is cheap mid-week vegetarian meal - although you could add meat or fish to this meal.

method.text: Put spinach in a pan. Cover and cook over a medium heat for 10 min. Drain well, squeeze spinach dry. Then chop finely.

Return spinach to pan. Add butter and ricotta cheese. Stir over a low heat for about 4 min until evenly mixed and butter melted. Remove from heat. Beat in eggs, cheese, flour and seasoning. Set aside to cool.
Put tomato sauce ingredients into a pan and bring to boil. Simmer uncovered for 10-15 min, stirring occasionally.

To cook dumplings, lower about 3 spoonfuls of the spinach mixture, a few at a time, into gently simmering water. After 5 min, they should rise to the surface. Lift out with a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen paper. Transfer to a lightly oiled shallow heatproof dish and keep hot in a warm oven until all dumplings are cooked.

title: Spinach dumplings with tomato, red pepper and lemon sauce
